Reviews.Title: “Cute, reasonable for Paris and clean”
Reviews.Author: chanimal28
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here and both have been excellent. bathroom is spacious and clean, as is the rest of the room. Given hotels are insanely and obnoxiously expensive in Paris (like everything else), this one offers an amazing value for the money. Excellent restaurants right down the street and in walking distance of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kj007-342
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for one week March 2012. The entire staff was incredibly cordial, sincerely friendly, helpful and nice. The same can be said of the neighborhood where we always would feel secure. Great food nearby; the Metro is close. Nice, nice, nice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely quiet hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: Sara S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Very friendly quiet hotel in a nice quiet street in St Germain. Good transport links. Helpful staff. Comfortable room, if a little small and with subdued lighting. Lobby seating comfortable, relaxed and uncrowded. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Frank_2011_12
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to find a nice Parisian hotel that was charming, not touristy, not overly expensive, not a matchbox size and located in the heart of the city. I found it with Hotel Sainte Beuve. Starting with the reservations done via email and ending with our check out, everything was handled with excellent customer service. In addition to the hotel arrangements, the hotel also helped us book restaurant reservations at some of Paris' finest restaurants. I have to say that I had modest expectations when I started my Paris hotel booking, after reading the many Trip Advisor posts on bad Paris hotel experiences. But after staying at Hotel Sainte Beuve, this is a true gem of a hotel. I will definitely return. Laetitia, who works the front desk is absolutely wonderful and Laurent, the owner, has great knowledge about everything in the city. They helped make our stay incredibly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie029
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this lovely hotel. The room was clean and well appointed. Breakfast was lovely, and the service was excellent - front desk very pleasant and helpful. The lobby seating area beside the log fire is a nice place to enjoy a glass of wine. The area is fairly quiet, but there are some nice restaurants less than 5 minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: BandBs
Reviews.Content: This was one of our most enjoyable stays in Paris. The hotel is classic Paris boutique. Our room was a bit small, but the location was perfect--three metro stops a few minutes walk away--excellent staff, great Bistros all around, plenty of banks with ATMs. We loved our little balcony. The front desk was always helpful with suggestions and reservations. We couldn't ask for a better experience. The hotel is on a side street, so in spite of being in the middle of a busy area, it was really quiet. The hotel lobby was charming and the breakfast was better than anything we found at nearby restaurants. Everything was clean and recently redecorated. All in all, a delightful Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect stay in paris”
Reviews.Author: ttoronto
Reviews.Content: We had several requirements for a hotel in Paris: 1. Small and charming 2. In an area with a true neighbourhood feel 3. Close to a metro station 4. Relatively central 5. Around $200 a night The Sainte Beuve delivered on all our must-haves - it was absolutely lovely. Our room was simple yet pretty, with a large window that opened up onto a little wrought iron balcony. The common areas on the main floor were charming and comfortable, and the service was always warm and friendly. Breakfast was quite expensive (hotel breakfasts in Paris generally are), so we had our morning meals at the Cafe Vavin, just around the corner. The location was wonderful. The Sainte Beuve is in Montparnasse, a block away from the amazing Jardins Luxembourg, where we spent a lot of time wandering. There were lots of great little shops and bakeries and cafes in the area to enjoy, and plenty of charming little side streets to explore. It felt like a real neighbourhood and wasn't touristy at all. The weather was great, and we saw lots of locals (especially families with small kids) out enjoying the park. We had access to three metro stations nearby, and getting to the "touristy" areas closer to the Seine only took a few minutes - though we tended to walk more often than we took the metro because it was more fun. We booked on Expedia, and our room worked out to about $215 Canadian a night, which was within out budget - and it was worth every penny. If you choose to stay here, don't miss eating at Le Timbre, a wonderful, tiny restaurant just a few doors down from the hotel. The person behind the desk at the hotel will make reservations for you. But book ahead - it's a popular spot (deservedly so).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Raul H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for just a couple of nights on the final leg of our European getaway and were not dissapointed. This is a really nice hotel with very helpful staff. There are many great places to eat and drink around here and the Metro stop is not too far either. It was a little expensive but them again so is everything in Europe. If the daily rate was 25 euros less it would be perfect but oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojoDorset
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel St Beuve and espcially appreciated the quietness of the area and the fact we were an easy stroll to the Luxembourg Gardens. Even the Pantheon was only 15 minutes very attractive walk away. This hotel is very pleasantly run and furnished - and we were glad we'd booked a larger room as even that wasn't huge. It did, however, have a small balcony with a table and 2 chairs which would have been delightful in warmer weather. The bathroom was excellent and the bed extremely comfortable with good-quality linens. We passed up the prospect of the rather expensive hotel breakfast and instead headed for a nearby pavement cafe where we had great tartines and coffee for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Our Choice”
Reviews.Author: housespecialty1
Reviews.Content: Just back from a "girls trip to Paris" and our stay at Hotel Sainte Beauve was all that we had hoped for. Recommended by a friend that travels there often, we were happy very happy with the accommodations and the friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Elegant, Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Zaraselby
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights with my daughter. Staff are wonderful and helpful, rooms clean and huge attention to detail. Example: Our room had a sort of a lounge chair in it. I had my lap top set up in front of it. One day we returned to find the lounge chair replaced by a desk chair! The whole feel of the place is very "well done," beautifully decorated with antiques in the rooms etc. Breakfast was very good but expensive, of course. Bathrooms lovely, spotless every night (and we didn't leave them that way I can assure you!) This is central Paris so the rooms are small with little storage space. This is not a criticism, but it a fact and worth knowing. If you're travelling light as a tourist or on business this is no problem. If you're a clothes horse you will at the very least want to book one of their larger rooms (we were in a smaller room.) The street is quiet and lovely, and a short walk to the Luxembourg garden and to several different metro lines.

Reviews.Title: “tres magnifique!!!”
Reviews.Author: dsq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights while we were in Paris and could not have been happier. The hotel is in a great location - in the 6th arrondisement in between 2 metro stations and on a quiet side street. Close to great restaurants too. Be sure to dine at Le Timbre 2 doors down the street- a 5-star restaurant that exemplifies prime Paris cuisine. Hotel staff are excellent. If your French is rusty like ours, you will feel comfortable speaking in just about any language. John speaks fluently in 5 !. John and others were very gracious in just about anything we needed. We were very pleased and recommend Hotel Sainte Beuve to everyone. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good though maybe better value available.”
Reviews.Author: travelplanner057
Reviews.Content: Lovely quiet street. My daughter and i had nice but not overly generous room overlooking street. Good sized bathroom-fridge in room was useful. Excellent helpful staff. Close to 2 Metro lines. Later this trip i stayed in Hotel Luxembourg Parc hotel -same area- which was also nice. We got a discount rate online for this which made it better value.. Next time i would choose on basis of price.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: STJGirl
Reviews.Content: Tucked down a quiet side street close to the Metro and the Jardin du Luxembourg, my husband and I found this small boutique hotel to be tasteful and comfortable. We booked a superior double room for 4 nights and were pleased with the size of the room and bathroom. We had plenty of space for our things and the bedding was comfortable. We did not opt for the hotel's (pricey) breakfast because there were so many boulangeries and patisseries close by. Each morning we'd pop into this gorgeous little patisserie (Au Pain de Vavin) at the intersection of the Rue Vavin and Notre-Dame Des Champs for coffee and melt-in-your-mouth croissants. It was the perfect start to our days. The hotel's location on the Left Bank worked great for our daytime sightseeing plans and we enjoyed exploring the many cafes and bistros in the 6th (and the nearby 14th) at night. The hotel staff were friendly and I appreciated that they offered patient encouragement while I brushed up on my very rusty French language skills. Merci!!

Reviews.Title: “definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: bee90
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over new years last year, and booked based upon trip advisor reviews. it definitely did not disappoint. the rooms were beautifully decorated (though cosy as is always the case in Paris!) with a beautiful bath, and there were lots of good restaurants near by. An easy walk up to St germain, and the staff were really helpful and friendly. Breakfast was fantastic, if not a little expensive. A really nice alternative to the souless business hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noodlequeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed two night in two rooms and enjoyed a lovely stay. The staff spoke English and were very helpful. Even checking on several restaurants for us to make sure they were open and provided directions. Our rooms had small balconies and they were a nice touch. The rooms were clean and air-conditioned. We love Paris and will return to stay at this wonderful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjm073
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff. Clean rooms that are beautifully decorated. We plan to stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our Paris home”
Reviews.Author: mpb0344
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel in the 6th arr. (off Blvd Raspail near Vavin metro station) that was well located for our touring and activities during our week in Paris. Our jr. suite room was very comfortable with nice linens, ample closet and storage space and a nice bath. The room was nicely decorated. The lobby was welcoming and arrival felt like coming home. Staff were friendly, helpful and personable - maybe because it is a smaller property (24 rooms+-) - and they helped us feel welcome and secure. The neighborhood features enough cafes, a great pattisserie, and shops and was not a very long walk from many places we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “April in Paris ...”
Reviews.Author: RoperM
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were treated with gracious service and hospitality by all of the staff. We stayed in the Junior Suite for 8 nights, it was perfect. The king size bed was very comfortable, closet space more than adequate, sitting area great for reading or sharing a glass of wine, and the spacious, clean bathroom ideal for a couple. The local restaurants were "fabulous" .. .Le Timbre, Wadja, Mercerie Mullot, Deux Cigales and La Cerisaie. The hotel is ideally located within walking distance to three metro lines. (We only used a taxi to and from the airport.) We plan to return to this enchanting city ... soon and would stay at this charming, lovely hotel in the 6th.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Choice!”
Reviews.Author: drmike10941
Reviews.Content: Stayed on advise of a friend..Staff was exceptionally helpful and pleasant ..location was perfect for our first visit to Paris..Room was clean and comfortable..very easy to navigate around ..I would highly recommend the Hotel Sainte Beuve for you visit to Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but a very small room.”
Reviews.Author: WilliamAllen54
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a classy lobby and nice staff. The shower was great. The room was small. But, a lightbulb blew in a lamp and wasn't replaced until our 3rd day. Lighting in the room is odd anyway, we had to walk halfway into the room in the dark before we could find a light that would turn on. In order to keep our computer's charged we had to unplug a lamp...I'm not usually this obsessed with light but this got to be kind of a joke. We might stay there again but it wouldn't be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Shaz521
Reviews.Content: We had a superior room on the first floor overlooking the street. For a city hotel, the room and bathroom were spacious and very well decorated. Really comfortable bed. Breakfast was very good but a bit pricey. I'm sure, if you wanted, you could eat at one of the nearby cafes to reduce costs. Good choice of restauarnats and bars nearby for the evening. Excellent location - within 5 minuts walk of two metro stations and the entrance to the Luxumbourg Gardens. And not too touristy . The hotel isn't cheap but then nothing is in Paris and we thought it was very good money for value. Staff were polite, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBCbeach
Reviews.Content: The owner and manager greeted us warmly, even though we requested the room last minute. He also upgraded us for free. The rooms were beautifully decorated, and it was within walking of most anything you could need. The bartender waited on guests and made specialty cocktails for everyone. It is a small boutique hotel, so you won't have the amenities of the large chains, but I can't say enough about the management, cleanliness and hospitality of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Paris; we have come back for over 10 years”
Reviews.Author: petervail
Reviews.Content: The key to running a small hotel is the quality of the staff. For years we stayed at small hotels on the Ile St.Louis, but the staff were always changing and not at all welcoming. At the Sainte Beuve you will find a charming hotel with first class staff. Cecile makes you welcome on your arrival and provides all kinds of helpful information based on her many years in the hotel. Christian (who has been there for over 26 years!) helps with the luggage, and also serves breakfast in the room or downstairs. There is no restaurant, but Le Timbre, just a few yards down the street, is first class and great value. Close to three subway lines and a few minutes away from La Coupole and other world class restaurants. Only 5 minutes walk to the delightful Luxembourg Gardens,

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for Paris”
Reviews.Author: ryanmccoy05
Reviews.Content: the best location, the best neighborhood, and the best little hotel. The service was awesome and so were the accommodations. the hotel staff very friendly, the location is near 2 very good metros, this is a beautiful non touristy neighborhood. I could not recommend this hotel enough. my wife and I loved the choice. Thanks tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot First Paris Trip”
Reviews.Author: lent35
Reviews.Content: I used Trip Advisor for a great deal of our first trip to Paris. Hotel Sainte Beuve fit our criteria, viz., close to Isle de La Cite, on the left bank and a comfortable boutique hotel. It met all these criteria and then some. Starting with the desk and particularly Cecelia who was just so helpful. She provided assistance in many ways for restaurants, sites and just a friendly presence. With a tiny yet manageable elevator our room on the third floor overlooked rue Sainte Beuve. We had glorious weather so when in the room we had the window open. When we closed in the evening the double paned windows kept out all street noise. The hotel itself was very quiet. A good sized room by European standards. It had very comfortable beds, and a modern bathroom of good size. I had read previously that the breakfasts at 15E were expensive and one could do better at the local boulangeries. Well yes and no, if you want a croissant and an expresso. That view is correct. However my wife and I love good coffee in a real full sized cup for breakfast. Stainte Beuve's coffee is spectacular. a deep rich smooth blend and you are given a full three cup pot of coffee. This along with a basket of bread including croissant, freshly squeezed orange juice, a bowl of fresh fruit, a 6 oz. bottle of yogurt from Brittany, fresh Brittany butter and jams for 15E. All this either delivered to your room or served in a lovely salon on the entry level of the hotel. So easy when planning a busy day of touring. You couldn't get a better price at bistros in the area. I checked!!! Actually their kitchen was quite good for light meals and their potage for a light meal is not to be missed. There are many bistros and restaurants with a 10 second to five minute walk from the hotel all incredible. A few amenities in the area are a laundry - laverie, a maket with water, wine, beer, take out prepared snacks, a boulangerie, chacuterie really good pate and saucisson. Restaurants we loved on rue Raspail next to the hotel are Taverna di Gia excellent Italian, Bar a Huitres - wonderful seafood,a great tiny bistro on rue La Brea five minute walk is Les Deux Cigalles. A meal for two of two pasta dishes - really good, a salad which we split, and three glasses of wine at lunch - dejeunier was 27E!!!! For a special meal not outrageously priced is Le Timbre ten teps down the street from the hotel. and Le Dome Restaurant a famous Parisian seafood restaurant with a great wine list and spectacular foodl This hotel is truely a great spot. sainte Beruve

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Atmosphere, great staff”
Reviews.Author: may026
Reviews.Content: My son, husband and I had the pleasure of staying in the junior suite at the Hotel Sainte Beuve in May, 2011. This is the second time we've been. The hotel and furnishings are very pleasing. The staff members were all kind (and clever, in helping us with meals, other hotels). The neighborhood, is a touch out of the main touristic areas, but that's in many ways an advantage, if you like a calm, "real" lived-in neighborhood. And It's only a ten minute walk to the Luxembourg Gardens and St. Germain...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect week in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: BenandJules
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time last week in Paris. I chose the Hotel St. Beuve based on recommendations in Trip Advisor and I was very happy with my choice. It was a very quaint hotel in a nice neighborhood. The gentleman at the desk, "John", was very helpful and welcoming. He made excellent recommendations to us and willingly booked our dinner reservations each night. As others have mentioned, there is easy access to the Metro and lots of cute cafes nearby to eat at. Also, the breakfast at the hotel was great! We will definitely stay there again next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: WaldronofLondon
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at this lovely small hotel, quietly located a few minutes' walk from Notre Dame des Champs and Vavin Metro stations and a pleasant 10 minute walk from the Jardins de Luxembourg. Although we understand that there has been a recent change in ownership, standards remain high: delightful and helpful staff on the reception desk day and night and spotlessly clean rooms and bathrooms, Another great meal at Le Timbre, conveniently located 1 minute down the road from the hotel. We highly recommend it for lunch or dinner - set price dinner is 30 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet hotel with charm in a wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: dmMc
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 2 night stay at the Sainte Beuve in October, 2010. This was my first trip to Paris and wanted a small hotel in an interesting neighborhood. Went with a friend and we each had our own room. After traveling to other cities in Europe and staying as a single, I was pleasantly suprised at the size of the room and bathroom. VERY clean and comfortable. The hotel is steps away from the Luxembourg Gardens and there are many resturants in the area. There is a resturant that serves crepes right down the street that was very good for a light meal - with it's own resident cat who escaped while were were there and offered great entertainment! The hotel staff were great - they held our bags the last day so we could roam and when we came back, there was a thank-you note tied to our luggage with a red ribbon. How nice!

Reviews.Title: “Just a lovely comfy place to go back to after full days around Paris”
Reviews.Author: docjohncam
Reviews.Content: About 4 rooms per floor. Tiny lift. Very friendly staff. Decor and bathrooms very nice. 200m from Vavin Metro (17 mins direct line from Gare du Nord). Rue Sainte Beuve is not on the tourist map - its the next right turn after Rue Vavin going north on Boulevarde Raspail. Nice walk across Jardin de Luxembourg to and from Ile de la Cite (20 mins). Good Italian ice cream shop on Rue Vavin just after you leave the park on the way "home". Plenty of places to eat on Boulevarde du Montparnasse. Go up the Tour Montparnasse on your first night to see Paris after dark and see the Eiffel Tower light up (on the hour for a few minutes). Several good patisseries nearby (we like the people in the one on Vavin/NotreDame du Champs) so we didn't eat breakfast in the hotel. Have a look at BikeAboutTours - the best part of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- we'd happily return!”
Reviews.Author: bakery
Reviews.Content: I'm embarrassed that it took me so long to review this wonderful hotel. We liked everything about it. We booked the connected rooms, which were perfect for my husband and I and our two teenaged daughters. The location was perfect, just south of Jardin du Luxembourg and a two minute walk from two different metro stations. They served breakfast in the hotel, although we chose to eat breakfast at a nearby cafe. The best feature was the excellent service. Staff at the front counter was wonderfully helpful and truly helped us make the most of a great trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “The best decision made looking for a good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Thanaci
Reviews.Content: The staff in Saint Beuve Hotel is wonderful with a great hospitality . In our visit to Paris, even was a short stay, they have a personalized attention to make it unforgettable. The room was amazing and always kept clean . We are so grateful for their help in every detail and truly appreciate the time they spent to book our tours with the best decisions. Cecile and Cristhian always give the best effort making every guest feel comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but somewhat pricey”
Reviews.Author: ramosa
Reviews.Content: There seems to be some debate about where this hotel is located. The PropriÃ©taire says it's in the Latin Quarter, but the heading (atop the browser heading, which they control) oddly says "in saint germain de pres." Confusing and, perhaps, misleading. Alas, it is a fine hotel. I spent a series of days there recently. No complaints. But, if I were to stay again near the intersection of Raspail and Montparnasse, I'd stay at one of the hotels just across the intersection in Montparnasse, where the prices tend to much lower.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with v helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: weegirlnelly
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my first trip to paris with my husband. This hotel is great...very clean and quiet. the staff could not have been more helpful with directions and travel tips. when we arrived we were given two room keys and told we could pick the room we preferred! the rooms are lovely-ours had a balcony over looking a quiet street. the decor is boutique style and the bathroom was so quaint with a lovely hot shower over the bath. on the first few nights we walked home a good 20minute walk to the river. the hotel has a lovely bakery close by, a small supermarket, bank machine, lovely restaraunts and metro line all within a few minutes walk. perfect

Reviews.Title: “good but not in the heart of st. germaine”
Reviews.Author: 13traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, but it is not really in St. Germaine. Technically it is, but it really is on the border and some would probably say it is in the Monparnasse area. It is close to the Vavin metro, and a bit of a short walk to another metro stop. It is expensive, but because we traveled during the slowest month (Feb.), the rate was reasonable. The staff is friendly and the hotel is very quaint. The pictures on its website makes it seem much larger than it is. I wouldn't return to this hotel because I would want to be in a more centrally located area, near St. Germaine Des Pres for example. For the price they charge, I would want to be in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite French Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ciao49
Reviews.Content: If you do not stay at the Hotel Sainte Beuve you will be missing out on the best night of sleep, and the most amazing breakfast served by Christian. There is nothing more I can add to what has already been expressed about this hotel's location. It was perfect! In July we traveled to 3 countries, but Paris was truly the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accommodations”
Reviews.Author: sharedexperiences
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located and quiet. Room very comfortable, bathroom great, staff helpful. We arrived very late in the evening, and despite the hour were very warmly greeted.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: indecisive266
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really sweet, the rooms are a decent size and nicely decorated, the bathroom is great with a powerful shower. Reception staff are fantastic-friendly & helpful. The location is great inbetween 2 metro stops, close to cafes & resturants. I would recommend the chez clement by the Viven metro stop the food is great & reasonably priced. It rained the whole weekend & it was freezing but we saw lots and had a great weekend. i would definetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChristopherK
Reviews.Content: Selected it because it was walking distance to office I was visiting near Gare Montparnasse. Deluxe room was small but quiet and cozy for one. Bed very good. Windows opened for fresh air at night. Loved the bathroom with new tile, good lighting and great shower with good water pressure. Shower curtain could have been longer to tuck in at both ends of the tub. Overall, very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTwinMommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights while we were in Paris. We fell completely in love with this hotel. The staff were very friendly, welcoming, and always willing to help. We were very surprised by the size of the room. After reading some of the reviews I was expecting a shoe box, but that is not what we got. We were in room 23 on the sixth floor. Apparently, it is one of the largest rooms in the property; so ask for it! The windows that opened to look down on the street really made the place feel even more Parisian. The location could not have been better. Two different metro stations were just a short walk away. Great neighborhood with very reasonable priced cafes. It was so nice to come back to a quite place and rest up for the next day. This has to be one of the first hotels that we have stayed in where the place was fully booked and we never heard anyone! This is a solid choice! We most certainly would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: leslorne
Reviews.Content: The location is great-- right by the Vavin gate to the gorgeous Luxembourg Gardens and off the Boulevard Raspail for easy access to the Metro. Rooms are small but adequate (not much closet space though, so pack light!), the bed is comfortable, linens lovely, bathroom fully equipped and bright, with a heated towel rack. Staff couldn't be more helpful! Very quiet at night. In short-- perfect! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Paris sweetspot”
Reviews.Author: Conferencer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 days of a total of 10 days in Paris. Agree with all the previous positive comments: thanks to Tripadvisors for helping us choose. Deluxe double room on the top floor was very good value for money. Compact room (as one expects in Paris) but very adequate - we did not feel constrained at all; plenty of storage; refined decor; quiet with double-glazed windows. Minor niggles: small room safe (could not store a laptop), no tea/coffee facility in the room, fiddly reaching to power points on the angled wall - did not detract from a great experience. A small boutique hotel with charming bilingual staff who were always very pleasant and helpful: a taste of France (as opposed to a large impersonal chain hotel). Excellent room service. Combined bath-shower had a strong hot water flow and skylight. We didn't try the hotel dining - there were very good cafes nearby (recommend Cafe Vivan's "formule" breakfast to 1130h). Sited very close (2 blocks) to Vavin metro station - the No. 4 metro runs to many key points on the north-south axis in Paris including Gare du Nord, Gare de l'Est, Montmarte and key stops in central Paris and the Left Bank. The metro stop for the No. 12 line (Notre Dame des Champs) is also 1 block away. A short walk (2-3 blocks) to the large relaxing beautiful park of Jardin du Luxembourg. The small charming Le Timbre restaurant is in the same street: the best meal we had in Paris - a true gem of French cuisine. Plenty of shops, restaurants, cafes without feeling that we were in a tourist trap. Overall, it hit the sweet spot: genuine boutique hotel in a great site with great access for exploring Paris and very good value for money. Would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique in Great location”
Reviews.Author: tmactraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Sainte Beuve in August 2010. The hotel is set in a quiet street near the jardin du luxembourg that has close and easy access to 2 metro train lines. There are no shortage of Cafes near by for breakfast if you don't opt for the inhouse breakfast. The Hotel itself is a 6 odd floor beautiful old building with a classic "cosy" traditional lift and staircase. We were fortunately located on the first floor which ment that we did not have to use the lift, but which also ment we missed out on having a balcony. The rooms are cosy, but are well equipped with a separate toilet from the bathroom, safe, comfortable bed, antique furniture and heavy drapes. The service was very good considering how bad our French is - We had an panic with our flight time coming forward 45 minutes (which we discovered at 4am, 2.5 hours prior to the flight departure), and reception acted quickly to arrange us an earlier taxi - We would not have made the flight without them. A Great value hotel that we would love to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bevells
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Sainte Beuve for two nights over a weekend whilst visiting my niece. The location is absolutely perfect. You are on a quiet street extremely close to two Metro lines (4 and 12 - one of which ran direct from Gard du Nord) and are right by the Jardin du Luxembourg. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated in muted tones. I had a standard double which, although I loved the decor and the bathroom which was a decent size, the bedroom was absolutely tiny - I wouldn't have wanted two of us in it! Also, it overlooked the "yard" - which I misinterpreted as being a courtyard! It was actually just a small hollow space between buildings. As I was on the 1st floor, and the building went up about 5 floors, my room was in constant darkness. I truly had no idea what the weather was like. When I visited Paris was hot (thankfully the aircon was efficient) and bathed in beautiful sunshine but from my room you would think it was overcast or 9 o'clock at night! The only clue I had was by craning my neck out of the window and looking up towards the open square at the top to see whether it was blue sky or not! Consequently I could only do my make-up standing up in the bathroom as the lighting was too poor in the bedroom. That said, I would definitely stay in this hotel again but would book a room overlooking the street.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Paris”
Reviews.Author: joelsgirls
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10 years ago and the hotel is even better than remembered. Complete new interior design, done with love and a fabulous eye to detail. The black and white baths are gorgeous. The staff could not be more accomodating- 2 have been here for the past 10 years, which speaks well of the hotel. Fabulous location between 2 metro lines (Vavin & Notre Dame de Champs stops) only 1-2 blocks from the hotel. Numerous options for eating, even relatively inexpensive. Le Timbre for elegant 3 course dinner and the local Italian restaurant for a 2 course $20 dinner. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cozy in beautiful Paris!”
Reviews.Author: JacobsonElana
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk in the door, you are greeted by the calming colors and beautiful decor of the lounge and lobby. The service is amazing, friendly and helpful with dinner reservations and maps/directions. The rooms are very clean and make excellent usage of the space! We loved the black, white and chrome bathroom! The location is good - though it is a bit of a walk from the Seine and the main drag of Saint Germaine... though we took the metro everywhere! We had a wonderful time in Paris and this hotel and would definitely recommend to friends! We also loved the free wifi in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very French, boutique hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Abigaill
Reviews.Content: A really nice, boutique Parisian hotel within walking distance of the Left Bank. The staff went out of their way to make sure we had a comfortable stay. The rooms were clean and attractive, everything about the hotel pleasant and agreeable, with old-fashioned French touches amid the modern wide screen TVs, bathrooms etc. On the night we stayed we were, unfortunately, disturbed by a rowdy house party next door - but I suspect we were just unlucky as the street was otherwise tranquil. I would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler280
Reviews.Content: We only had an overnight stay at the hotel but we were very pleased with the location (near many of the popular spots in St. Germain area) and the staff helpfulness. We were greeted warmly at the front desk. We were immediately given a map and they showed us the hotel location and nearby useful places. For those interested in gardens the hotel is only 300 meters from Luxembourg Gardens, a great place to walk and relax after a long journey. The room was clean, nicely decorated (ours was a superior double), air conditioned and the bath/shower had ample room and new fixturing. It was too bad our stay was only overnight as we would have liked to stay longer. We would stay again at Sainte Beuve.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: LezahSwayHampshire
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this delightful hotel. Without exception the staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was quiet and cool because of the air conditioning. Decor lovely. The breakfast is very good - fresh fruit, yoghurt, fruit juice, breads, croissants, and preserves. The hotel is near the Luxembourg gardens and the metro and bus links are excellent. We ate in local restaurants and returned to a very comfortable bed for a good night sleep. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel near jardins luxumbourg”
Reviews.Author: likestotravellots
Reviews.Content: We had a couple days in Paris and stayed at the Hotel Sainte Beuve at the recommendation of my boss, who travels to Paris quite often. It was quiet, clean, charming-- the staff was very helpful and friendly; and the location near the jardins luxumbourg was ideal. There was a lovely breakfast served in the lobby, but we also could grab a pastry at the bakery around the corner and take it into the park-- eclairs for lunch! We had just a standard room, which was quite small, but pleasant and clean; the bathroom was decent sized and everything worked very well (water, air con, etc.) It's a reasonably priced hotel and I'd recommend it highly to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious helpful staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LelaKate
Reviews.Content: We found the desk clerk to be very helpful and professional. The interior of the hotel looked as if it has been recently remodeled, very tasteful design and inviting. Of the three hotels we stayed in on this visit, this was the nicest in every way.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Boston, MA - home of the Sox!
Reviews.Title: “Great, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigBuff_8
Reviews.Content: All of the other reviews are accurate. Its almost unnecessary to throw another one up there on the board like this, but I have to. The Sainte Beuve is a wonderful place to stay for a few days when visiting Paris as a tourist. The room we had (No. 9) was great. Not huge (which is, of course, typical of european city hotels), but with sufficient storage that we were able to put our stuff away comfortably and keep it organized. It was advertised with a queen bed, but I think it was a little bigger. Very comfortable. Wonderful bathroom with separate W/C. Tremendous water pressure from the shower and large, soft towels on a heated rack! Very luxurious. The window opened to the quiet Rue de Sainte Beuve. Location is perfect for a tourist visit to Paris. The hotel is a short walk from the RER (train from CDG), and two Metro stations. You can get anywhere you want in Paris very quickly - but why would you? You are right around the corner from the corner of Raspail and Montparnasse, where there are a large number of wonderful cafes and brasseries, including some made famous by the ex-pat American artists of the day (Hemingway, etc.). There is a great Cuban bar/restaurant a block away as well. There are even great restaurants right on the small Rue de Sainte Beuve. Sleeping quality was great. The room temperature was very comfortable and the double-glazed window sealed out all of the city noise. The staff is outstanding. Particularly helpful was Cecilia, who managed dinner reservations and other events for us, and who made sure we found our way to the hotel OK the first day. Go ahead and email them, they are very responsive. The price is very reasonable for Paris as well. Not cheap, but take advantage of current $US/Euro exchange rates. We did not take advantage of the breakfast option (fortunately, it is not included), because it seemed a little steep (15 euros), but the people that were enjoying it every morning seemed to think it was great. There are a number of pastry shops nearby that can provide a very filling start to your day for a fraction of the cost. We walked to all of the major attractions in the city, and you can use the Saine Beuve as a jumping off spot for all of them. Last but not least is the proximity of the Luxembourg Gardens. Beautiful spot, and a nice place to stroll through on your way to the major attractions. I travel a lot and don't love every place I have stayed, but this hotel is a real gem. You will not go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: borntotravel56
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 nights in this hotel (an extra 4 than planned due to the airport shutdown). Notwithstanding the trying circumstances of the last few days we thoroughly enjoyed the hospitality and professionalism of the staff. They were invariably helpful and understanding, doing thier best to help us with our predicament. They kindly reduced the room rate for the 4 extra days of our stay. The hotel has a lovely lobby with comfortable furnishings, elegant decoration and a working fireplace. Although the breakfast seemed expensive initially we found it to be good value and delicious compared to other options in the hotel vicinity. We wouldn't hesitate to stay in this little gem again the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Such an extraordinary hotel! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: firsttmer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Sainte Beuve and we couldn't have been more pleased. The room itself was fairly small but we were not lacking space at all. We had enough room for all our bags and we could even walk around the bed! ;) The room was furnished beautifully, with a lovely balcony that had a table with two chairs on it. The location of the hotel is fabulous. It is right near 3 metro stations (Vavin, Montparnasse-Bienvenue and N-D des Champs) and from these 3 stations it is so easy to get to pretty much anywhere in the city. It is also just next door from the Luxembourg gardens, which is a great morning stroll. There is also free wi-fi in the entire hotel, which made staying connected a breeze. Finally, the staff at the front desk were all extremely friendly and helpful. They never hesitated to give us the help we needed and were always extremely pleasant doing so. Overall, we truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and on our next trip to Paris we will be sure to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bang bang for your MONEY!!!”
Reviews.Author: rockmedude
Reviews.Content: What you get... and what you paid... I will say you are stealing from them!!! Friendly staff.... good but not great location (Toug all Paris I guess is good location given it a second tought)!! Only nahhh will be price of breakfast... rooms are cool... cozy place.... 10 out of 10... just like that

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, wonderful service, reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: WaldronofLondon
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this hotel, rightly described as a little gem. It is ideally located just a few minutes from Jardins du Luxembourg and a 2 minute walk from Notre Dames des Champs metro station on a sleepy side street (taxi drivers never know where it is, so you will need to direct them from Boulevard Raspail). There is a wonderful restaurant a few doors away, Le Timbre, which is well worth a visit too. The local bars and cafes are non-touristy. There are great shops - children's clothes, boulangerie and chocolates - on the nearby Rue Vavin. The hotel is walking distance, if you are energetic, from Boulevard St Germain. There is a theatre around the corner - very arty rather than swanky. We saw a Moliere play there. The service in the hotel is wonderful and not at all disdainful. The staff speak English (although we hope they appreciated our woeful French). They are happy to make recommendations for restaurants, places to see, etc. The bedrooms are not massive (we had an interconnecting superior double and standard twin; at least 2 rooms on each floor interconnect which is ideal if you have kids/teens with you) but are pleasantly furnished, and we had 2 delightful (but quite small) bathrooms. Some rooms overlook a rather plain and boring courtyard; others overlook Rue Sainte Beuve which is a sleepy side street - we were never woken up by traffic noise, and the windows are double glazed. The lift is also tiny, and if you use the stairs you will have to put the lights on. The public area downstairs is not massive but it is completely charming - a small bar area, and a sitting area with a real fire. Ideal in snowy January. We can't contemplate staying anywhere else now in Paris - even if we could afford to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Satkinson1
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely hotel. Unfortunately, like all hotels in Paris, it is expensive, but that is the only complaint. The decor is beautiful - not poncy like some boutique hotels, the beds are comfy, the street is quiet, it has a lovely cosy lounge/bar area, and is reasonably-well located in Montparnasse (a bit of a walk to the main tourist sites, but in a nice area and near plenty of Metro stops and good restaurants (like la Coupole - a stone's throw away)). The staff, too, are very friendly and helpful. All in all a delightful place to stay! I stayed with my boyfriend and another couple and they agreed. They paid slightly extra for a superior room (Rm 24), but I think our standard one (rm 6) was probably better - balcony outside and view of (quiet) street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huuhu
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our recent three night stay at the Sainte-Beuve. Everything about the hotel is lovely-the salon with the fireplace, rooms, bathrooms. Very comfortable beds as well. What really makes this place special is the staff. Everone goes the extra mile to make sure the guest is well taken care of. We have been to Paris many times and have stayed in any number of very good hotels and would heartily recommend the Sainte-Beuve without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection...attention to every detail”
Reviews.Author: ShowMe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Paris with a six night stay at Hotel Sainte Beuve. This hotel was selected after hours of research and the reading of numerous reviews. Hotel Sainte Beuve did not disappoint, in fact it surpassed our very high expectations. Arrival from CDG was very easy as the hotel is only a short walk from the RER B Port Royal stop. Check-in was efficient and we were soon settled in room #12 on the 3rd floor. Our standard room met our needs perfectly. Since we were out of our room from morning until night, we had no need for a room with a view. The room was decorated beautifully and the linens were lovely. One side of the room has a built-in with space for hanging clothes, shelves for folded clothes, a safe, and mini-bar fridge. The room also has a mounted flat panel TV which has English speaking CNN. The bath is absolutely sparkling with its black/white decor and chrome fixtures. Robes, slippers, and a hair dryer are provided. The heated towel rack is wonderful for drying any hand washables. The room is spotless and is serviced daily. An alcove off of the cozy lobby area provides a computer for guest use. The entire hotel is Wifi. After a busy day of sightseeing, we also looked forward to returning to the hotel and sitting by the fire for a bit. We ate breakfast at the hotel just one morning. The breakfast for 15E was delicious- basket of croissants and bread, jam, yogurt, fresh mixed fruit cup, freshly squeezed OJ, and coffee/tea/hot chocolate. The hotel is perfectly situated with cafes, restaurants, shops, and metro stops within very short walking distances. But adding to the already outstanding features of this boutique hotel is its exceptional staff-the majority speaking excellent English. Every person we interacted with was professional, courteous, and helpful. On our last evening, we noticed a mistake in our next day's travel arrangements. The young gentleman at the reception desk , with much patience and efficiency, booked alternate travel and provided explicit directions for arriving at the train station and purchasing the reserved ticket. During our stay, the reception staff made two dinner recommendations and reservations for us. The recommended restaurants were outstanding. The amenities, comfort, and exceptional staff of this lovely hotel made for a memorable trip. Every detail- from furniture selection and accessories, to linens, to selection of incredible staff -at Sainte Beuve has been thoughtfully chosen. Upon a return to Paris, there is no doubt that our hotel choice will again be Hotel Sainte Beuve.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of an Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Advanceddriver
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. It is beautifully furnished, warm and cosy with a very relaxed feel to it. The staff are unobtrusive and delightful. We were thrilled to find it. The location is excellent, with public transport and good restaurants nearby, however it is in an unusually quiet spot. We were not woken by the sound of traffic at all. The breakfast was delicious and went on until midday. I would just mention that some of the rooms are a little small, as they often are in Paris, and they do vary, so it might be worth discussing this when booking. I can't wait to go back, and now we would not stay anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful; small, elegant, in the ideal location with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: bird079
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the internet and booked over the phone - very easy as the staff spoke perfect english and an e-mail confirmation was provided. Whilst in a very convenient location to st Germain, the hotel is tucked in a quiet side street and in very easy walking distance to metro and buses. The rooms are very comfortable and the bathrooms especially so with separate toilets and lovely linen - the only shortcoming is no tea/coffee makings. The staff were lovely, arranging restaurants and taxisetc and the breakfast was wonderful and reasonably priced. We would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian Gem!”
Reviews.Author: bethtye
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels previously but this hotel is most certainly one of the best in Paris! My husband and I read the reviews and booked on line for our honeymoon, we then hoped for the best....We were not disappointed on any aspect of the hotel. The rooms and decor are classy and original. The service was second to none. Cecile and Phillipe at the front desk could not do enough to help us and ensure our trip was perfect. Nothing was too much much trouble for them. They provided a map and helpful hints so we were easily able to navigate our way around the city. The location is 2minutes walk from two of the main metro lines with easy access to the whole of Paris. The area which the hotel is located is charming and there are many local shops, bars and restaraunts to choose from, all within easy walking distance. I can not say enough about this wonderful hotel and its staff. It scores 10 out of 10 and we will definately be staying there again on our return to Paris next year.

Reviews.Title: “magnifique”
Reviews.Author: mathieu13
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in this charming boutique hotel. Rooms were clean, nicely decorated and perfect for our family of 4. Children would love the luxembourg garden close by. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice and cosy but dark and a little noisy.”
Reviews.Author: LeChatNoirLeeds
Reviews.Content: The hotel exterior and lobby look so welcoming after a day on your feet. The cosy sitting area with the fireplace is lovely. The stairs are dark but they were on a motion sensor so it was good for the environment!! When we arrived in our room we thought our Classic room was small and quiet noisy and dark - Boulevard Raspail is quite busy (but everywhere is in Paris). The room was however beautifully decorated with rich colours and fabrics. Our beds were changed everyday and it was nice to be able to open the french window to view the street. But there were a few little annoying things like, no main light in the room, the extractor fan wasn't working in the bathroom or toilet, no mirror in the bedroom, so it was a little difficult to see when you were getting ready to go out. Also drinks, breakfast and food were quite expensive, so we went along a few streets to find a Formule Petit DÃ©jeuner for 9 euros (ham and eggs, orange juice and hot drink). Overall, we really loved the hotel, but for the price we thought the room could have been bigger and breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Christine M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. It is very clean and quiet. The internet was free and fast. The area is nice. I did walk from the hotel to the right bank, but I think it is very far since the hotel is at the bottom of the 6th. The standard room is very small and difficult to maneuver around suitcases. Luckily we were there for a few nights and could unpack, making it no big deal. The room window faces the airshaft between buildings (the hotel refers to it as a courtyard). It is incredibly dark and difficult to tell the weather outside or even the time of day. That said, you will need a wakeup call every morning, regardless of the time you are getting up. The positive side of this is, it is very quiet and easy to sleep. The only complaint I had was that I was charged 5 euro (10 euro for 2 people) for orange juice, which I think is an outrageous price. As a result, I think eating/drinking in the hotel for breakfast is a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we had hoped for...”
Reviews.Author: Chachmoohach
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful time we had at Hotel Sainte Beuve last week. 10 of us were there to celebrate our mother's birthday and nothing was a problem from the second we arrived. The rooms were beautiful and stylish (my room was even upgraded free on check-in - just because....) and the location was perfect (so close to Metro stop 'Vavin' which takes you straight to Gare Du Nord - great for Eurostar). The staff were very friendly and helpful too (especially the man on the front desk when we arrived - I didn't catch his name). The ONLY negative was that after our check-in the wrong key was given to some other guests who then tried to get into one of our rooms. A little mistake and one that was rectified quickly. Apart from that the stay was seamless. Communication before our arrival via email was prompt and friendly. We wanted a recommendation for a special dinner and the hotel came up trumps with a great place and even phoned and booked it all for us. They also phoned ahead to the restaurant to confirm our arrival. All 10 of us agreed it was a great boutique hotel and our mother (who is not always the easiest to please) said it was her favourite holiday ever. Wow. We will definitely return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Weekend at the Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwdelray
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sainte Beuve at the bottom of the 6th is charming, lovely, perfect, romantic, and wonderful. The staff especially Cecilia were fantastic and had wonderful recommendations for restaurants (Le Timbre right down the street was truly delicious and perfect). The location between two metro lines was ideal. It's also just two blocks from the gorgeous Luxembourg Gardens. Things you should know: the water pressure was unbelievably good, I loved that shower! It's so QUIET (and our room had no alarm clock--we slept til 1 the first day, oops!). Easy to grab a sandwich at the patisserie up the street, or a coffee and croissant at Le Select or La Coupole, barely two blocks away. Great drinks at Smoke and Rosebud bars (Smoke MUCH less expensive but also not as classy). What else is there--anyway, it was was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Quiet but Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Davies72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sainte Beuve early in September with my husband and 13 year old son. We had the junior suite - the Sainte Beuve room and he had the room next door. The Hotel is very near the Luxembourg gardens and Montparnasse, on a quiet one way street. There are a number of metro stations very close by and Gare Montparnasse as well. It also in easy walking distance of many of the main sights - Musee Dorsey, the Louve, Notre Dame etc. Our room was large being a junior suite but even our son's room was large, especially for Paris. The rooms were nicely decorated in a tasteful but individual way. The bathrooms were also a generous size for Paris and immaculately clean. The plumbing was all very modern and up to date with great water pressure. We also enjoyed the set breakfast of juice, fruit salad, yoghurt, and bread basket with jam. The staff were helpful and pleasant and there was a nice lounge to sit in where they served afternoon tea. We throughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-wonderful vibe”
Reviews.Author: guapo1111
Reviews.Content: What a place! At the end of July, my wife and I splurged and stayed in the Sainte-Beuve suite on the 5th floor, and our teen-age son slept down the hall in a smaller room. The bathrooms in both rooms were fabulous - my wife loved the bathtub - the beds were comfortable - the rooms quiet - but the location was my favorite thing about this hotel. The Luxembourg Gardens are mind-blowing, and the brasseries surrounding the Sainte Beuve are top-notch. Every morning we walked a block away to our favorite breakfast spot (and late evening pastis hangout) .. the Brasserie Vavin. We also had two really good meals at the Rotonde (2 blocks away.) The Metro was a wonderful thing (and very close to the hotel.) And finally, thanks to Hakim at the front desk for all his help! Someday we'll return!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decor and super clean...but not the location for me.”
Reviews.Author: pricklypoppy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St. Beuve with my mother and teenage daughter for five nights in June. We stayed in connecting rooms 7 and 8. My daughter and I stayed in the front room. It was quiet, ample in size, and the window overlooked the street. The yellow-green walls were a nice contrast to the crisp white bedding. My mother stayed in the interior room. Even though the decor was really nice in reds and purple, the room was quite small and had no air circulation. Likes: The rooms and bathrooms are immaculate. I really appreciated how clean this hotel was! The bathrooms are fairly fabulous and tiled in black and white - a welcome reprieve from beige travertine. The front desk is helpful and gracious about speaking English. The lobby is nicely decorated (David Hicks interior design). There is a crisp, stylish feel to this hotel and the lobby is really inviting. Dislikes: The location is really too far to comfortably walk to the sights. If you don't mind the metro, there are two stops nearby but if you prefer to be above ground, this hotel might not suit you. The hallway and stairwell light is run on a motion sensor but it does not work. I was often walking in the dark. I understand the need to conserve energy but not at the expense of safety. Also, the curving stairwell is pretty but you never get to experience it because it is always dark. The room service breakfast needs improvement. With all the great French bakeries, who wants a couple of slices of dry bread, especially brown bread? Plus, there was no cream for the coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by three stars!”
Reviews.Author: Thegirllovesyoga
Reviews.Content: I work for an airline and have stayed in some beautiful hotels all over the world, and to be honest, I don't normally choose 3* hotels! However, I had a read an article in Vogue magazine about a year ago and they loved it. I then read all the reviews on TripAdvisor and knew this was something special. The hotel is chic and comfortable, in a lovely part of Paris. Yes there are 3 metro stations nearby and RER station, but it is a wonderful quartier to wander round and explore. Our room was at the top of the hotel and simply yet elegantly decorated. The bathroom was small but very well appointed. We chose to have breakfast downstairs in the small public area and it was delicious! Simple but top quality ingredients - what more do you want? So, don't be like me and be hesitant about booking the hotel because it only has three stars. It is a delicious little gem!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGranby_CT
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first trip to Paris and we were so very happy with the hotel and especially the personnel. After much research, I selected this hotel based on the reviews in Trip Advisor and was not diappointed. We stayed in two adjoining rooms which accomodated five of us (which included my mother-in-law) comfortably. The rooms were impeccably clean and nicely decorated. The baths were large and so very clean. But most of all, the hotel staff were so helpful and made our stay most memorable. Thank you especially to Nicolas and to Thomas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!! Great Location!!! Great Service!!! Friendly Staff!! No Complaints!!”
Reviews.Author: Chef_Bernie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel this weekend. I have no complaints. It was in an Ideal location, close to several Metro lines. It was a 10 min Journey to pretty much all the major sites in paris. The room was excellent, clean and decorated nicely. Bathroom was perfect. Came with bathrobes, slippers and even cotton swabs for the ladies. Staff very friendly, knowlegable and helpful. The resteraurants by the hotel were brilliant. Spent Friday night at the Rotundre and people watched the night away. Reccomendations: Drink wine! Its cheaper than beer, spirits. Reccomend the Cote Du Rhone. Simply delicious. Did my research once again on Tripadvisor, Been to Cuba, Greece and now Paris. Never dissapoints. One word for this weekend. Fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Deserves the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: PTsontour
Reviews.Content: Booked the Sainte Beuve after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. Excellent location. 10 mins walk from RER station to CDG and 25 mins walk to Place de la Concorde. Surrounded by restaurants and cafes. The room was spotless with lovely french doors opening onto the balcony above the street. The bed was the comfiest we've ever experienced in a hotel. The guys on the reception desk were great - helpful, jolly and only too happy to assist. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MadRae
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at Hotel Sainte Beuve, we were greeted by Cecile, which is a reason in itself to stay here. Without asking and without any additional charge, our party of three was upgraded to a larger room. The room was spacious considering there were three of us and some of us had overpacked. :) It was also very light, charming, and French. The bathroom was lovely; it recently had been redone (very tastefully) and was sparkling clean. The windows were double-paned and soundproofed; we did not hear any street noise with them closed. There was a very small balcony which looks over a quiet street. The elevator was extremely small and we had to take our luggage up in trips, but this was not a major or even a minor drawback from our overall experience. (note comment about overpacking) The lobby area was welcoming and comfortable. We did not take advantage of the breakfast room, but we were served drinks in the cozy sitting room. Regarding the staff, as mentioned, Cecile takes great pride in Paris and interest in visitors seeing it in the best light. Nicolas also works the front desk; he is very sweet and happy to help guests navigate the city. They both enhanced the experience of staying in this hotel and in Paris itself.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent small boutique hotel in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: sps2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting France and Paris for the first time for our 40th wedding anniversary. I had spent a great deal of time preparing for the trip which began on the Cote d' Azur and wound its way through France and eventually to Normandy and then ending in Paris. We had searched the websites of many hotels in Paris and finally stumbled on the website for the Sainte Bueve. It was a lovely hotel. The room in which we stayed (#4) was quite small, but very clean. As almost everyone writes - you spend very little time in the hotel room, so the small size is not a problem. The staff was incredibly helpful - and seemed, in no way, to be offended or unwilling to help us even though our French is, for all intents and purposes, non-existent. I really can't imagine anyone staying here and being disappointed -especially since the price is very reasonable for a hotel in any cosmopolitan city in the world. The location near the Luxembourg Gardens and within easy walking distance of Notre Dame and the Louvre was another real positive. Thanks so much to the staff that wawas so warm and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Lisa78780
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a week-long stay at the Sainte Beuve hotel and we were delighted with every aspect of this hotel. We stayed in room 7 which opened onto the quiet street Sainte Beuve. The room had a large bathroom and closets and we really enjoyed opening the big window to listen to the sounds of Paris. All of the employees went out of there way to make their guests happy. Almost all speak some English while the day shift front desk are fluent in it. (My teenage daughter thought Nicolas was adorable!). This hotel is near several lines on the Metro, near numerous Restaurants, cafes, brasseries and shops and is 2 streets over from the Luxembourg gardens. I booked this hotel based solely on Trip Advisor comments and ratings and I was very pleased. It does have free WiFi in the rooms too and is directly across the street from a pharmacy and a Veterinarian. My only complaint is that 2 of the outlets in the room did not work (yes, I had an adapter) making it hard for 2 of us to get ready to go out but this was NOT a big problem.

Reviews.Title: “want a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: malone2012
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel. it was our frist time in paris and wasnt sure were to stay so after reading the reviews on it we were sold. its in a lovely area off paris and it felt really safe. there was lots of places to eat near by and the metro was just a few steps from the hotel which was very easy to use. the staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful they made us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived to the second we left. i would recommed this hotel cause it was great in everyway clean, tidy, safe, friendly and vaule for money.

Reviews.Title: “Everthing I want in a Paris hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FirBolag
Reviews.Content: Coming up from the Metro, having spent three nights at Hotel Bellechasse ,it seemed like I was going to to be let down.I turned the corner walked into the hotel and had a pleasurable surprise :really friendly service.I had one of the larger rooms ,comfortable bed,all the amenities perfect without being pretentious.The room was quiet.A great cafe around the corner and walking distance to everything I needed.The attractive woman at reception tolerated and helped me with my french and encouraged my desire to learn more.I was seduced by the Hotel Sainte Beuve but not without good reason.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and nice”
Reviews.Author: grayhosue
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights here on the basis of excellent and generally accurate reviews here and in guide books. BUT with what I now think was misguided frugality I booked a standard room and it was really tiny and very dark. It was reasonably priced given the appealing location and overall charm and quality of the hotel but I don't think I would recommend staying in a standard room here unless the budget was totally inflexible; I might very well return to the Sainte Beuve but I would choose to pay more for a superior room. The standard room we had was attractively decorated, as the hotel's Web site illustrates, but it was so small that there was literally not room to walk between suitcase and bed. And it looked out on an airshaft so small and tall that even on a wonderfully sunny morning I thought it was cloudy and damp until I craned my head up to see blue sky. The bathroom was really nice however--spacious and well-lit and pretty--probably the same as the bathrooms in the superior rooms. There was no overhead light in the room and the lamps have tiny bulbs so you cannot read at night, And because there is no natural light in the room it has a drearier air than it should given the simple but tasteful furnishings. The public rooms are very comfortable and attractive. The staff was delightful and helpful both when we arrived and throughout our stay. The location is very good--a few extra Metro stops beyond the more expensive St Germain hotels but not excessively far; the neighborhood loses charm quickly as you approach Boulevard Montparnasse but gets even nicer than the immediate street as you approach Luxembourg Gardens. We did not get the hotel breakfast but had delicious croissants and coffee at a bar across from the gardens both mornings we were there--very reasonable, very pleasant, and on our way to our day's explorations.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier with the amenities and service.”
Reviews.Author: kdub-barker
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation stay at this hotel purely based on what we read on Trip Advisor...and we were more than pleased! My husband took me to Paris for my 40th birthday, and we had just learned we are pregnant with our first child. After reviewing several hotels in different parts of the city we liked the fact that we were close, within walking distance of many sights, but also had very easy access with 3 very close metro stops to the other destinations we wanted to visit. There was plenty of dining around the hotel, and great little shops on the street behind Beuve (on Vivan). The service was fantastic and the staff was friendly, helpful, and more than accommodating. We arrived at 6:30am, as our overnight flight from the US arrives early in Paris. We went to check our luggage at the hotel and find a local place to get a meal and relax before checkin (which was either 1 or 2pm). They were so kind and checked us in early...and upgraded our Superior Room to the Jr. Suite. It was wonderful to be able to go upstairs, shower, and take a nap before heading out into the city. The breakfast at the hotel is pricier than what you'll find in local cafes(which is to be expected in any hotel), however, it was absolutely delicious and we were spoiled so we at there every morning. We couldn't wait to get downstairs and start the day with their breakfast. It was one of our absolute favorite places that we've stayed and we'd stay there again in a heartbeat! It is in a great location -- just outside of the major touristy hub-bub of Paris, while still being centrally located in Paris. We didn't have all the late-night street noise or corridor noise that you hear complaints about in hotels located on the "main drag" or the "heart of the action" or in larger hotels. It was also surprisingly spacious and the baths were larger than expected after what we've read about most hotel accommodations in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melbs_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just gorgeous. As soon as you walk in you feel as though you are in a gorgeous home rather than a hotel. The staff are great. They helped us book restaurants etc and spoke perfect english. Our room was great, beautifully decorated and a good size with a large bathroom and seperate toilet which is rare in european hotels. We would absolutely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous decor”
Reviews.Author: LeiB
Reviews.Content: If you like interior design you will like this small boutique hotel which is decorated beautifully with lots of attention to detail. Rooms are small but nicely decorated. Friendly service. location to the south of the 6th arrondisement so a bit of a walk to the centre but close to metro and local restaurants of which I would recommend Wadja and avoid Le Closerie de Lilas. Breakfast at 15 euros a bit high for what you get but there is also a la carte menu to just pay for what you want. Would definitely recommend if you like small boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Sainte-Beuve is just as wonderful as its reviews indicate.”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravel065
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough positive things about the Sainte-Beuve! Our family group included grandparents, a daughter and grandchildren ages16 and 11; we stayed in adjoining rooms, which was a perfect arrangement for us. The rooms were beautiful, bathrooms were roomy, beds were extremely comfortable. Breakfast was excellent, with fresh fruit and wonderful pastries. The location is very convenient, in a safe area near excellent restaurants and two metro stations. The lobby is very cozy, with a fire on cool days. Best of all was the staff (both at the desk and at breakfast) who went out of their way to see that our visit was truly memorable. I left my cell phone in the room when we checked out; the staff promptly searched for it and mailed it to me; I'm not sure many hotels in Paris (or elsewhere) would have been so accomodating. So a huge "thank-you" to everyone at the hotel and the highest recommendation of the Sainte-Beuve. The cost was a bit more than some of the hotels we considered, but, after staying there, I think it was well worth it. We will certainly stay at the Sainte-Beuve again! GEORGIA

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jd0806
Reviews.Content: After endless searching on the internet on where to stay in Paris one phone call to this wonderful find made our decision. The person that answered the phone identified himself as Nicolas. He was helpful and accommodating. That attitude was portrayed by every staff member on our 3 day stay. The rooms were clean, bed was comfortable, the hotel has charm and is in a great location.We have only great things to say about our experience. We canâ€™t wait to return when we have more time.

Reviews.Title: “Peacefully, charming Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: Daisy0508
Reviews.Content: A charming intimate hotel, with friendly welcoming staff. A beautifully furnished little lobby area and typically Parisian bedrooms (small, but furnished with all you could need. Away from the manic tourism of some areas, and perfectly placed to wander the more relaxing & authentic areas and while away the days between pastries and sitting in the park!

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie61
Reviews.Content: Just finished a three night stay at the Hotel Sainte Beuve. It was a delightful place, as everyone on Trip Advisor attests. The small living room/dining area by the entrance are beautiful decorated and comfortable, making one feel like being in the home of a friend with lovely taste. Our room was decorated uniquely and with charm. The staff were very helpful, spoke English perfectly, and were very welcoming. This was our first trip to Paris. The location seemed great... lots of nice shops and cafes nearby, easy access to the Metro (though we didn't use it) and an easy 10 minute walk to and from the "RER" commuter train that brings you from and to Charles de Gaulle Airport. The hotel is on a small quiet street just off a main street, and there was no street noise at all in the room. The beautiful Luxembourg Gardens are right around the corner... a beautiful respite from the city. Also, the breakfast (an added 15 euros) was delicious... wonderful croissants and other breads, fresh squeezed orange juice, a pot of coffee, fresh fruit salad and yogurt. Seemed like the perfect way to start the day. A lovely small hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Sainte Beuve”
Reviews.Author: QBnKG
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we were looking for somewhere quiet and romantic, with a contemporary ambience. After spending many evenings searching online for accommodation for our 4 night holiday, we finally went with our first instincts and settled on the Sainte Beuve. We were not disappointed! We thoroughly enjoyed the quiet, restful room (we were at the back of the hotel), the cleanliness, the very comfortable bed, the large bathroom, and the helpful and friendly staff. The location was great too: easy to arrive with suitcases via the Metro, an enjoyable walk from all the sights, and with many bars and restaurants nearby. We also found everything - the room, lobby, bar area etc - to be exactly as they appeared on the website photos. Very, very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: arttatum5000
Reviews.Content: We had a great mini-break at the Sainte Beuve, and the friendliness and helpfulness of all of the staff was outstanding. The room was perfect, very quiet at night, breakfast delicious, great bathroom. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it!”
Reviews.Author: elldee75
Reviews.Content: During my 2 week stay in Paris and Versailles I tried 4 different hotels, as I feel that your experience of a city is shaped by where you are staying, so I moved around to different districts. The St. Beuve exceeded my expectations by far, and made my trip to Paris enjoyable and memorable. This hotel is elegant and classy. The room I stayed in was the mid-level for 170 Euro (I think that's probably an off-season rate though, so it will likely be more in spring, summer and fall). I absolutely loved it. It was spotlessly clean and the decor really added to the experience of being in Paris. I had a wonderful, lengthy terrace with walk-out windows and spent two evenings sitting at the little table out there, watching Paris go by. It's touch and go with many Parisian hotels if you will get a full bath, even if you specifically order it. The bathroom of the St. Beuve puts my bathroom at home to shame. True elegance and an enormous bathtub, which was a pleasure after a long day spent walking the cobble stones. Hot water day and night (also the exception and not the rule for many 3-star Parisian hotels which turn down the water heater after 7 p.m.)The mini -bar was a nice touch, as was the North American style blowdryer (you will find most hotels in Paris, even the 4 stars, provide in-wall blowdryers similar to a vacuum cleaner that blows air out, but it takes about an hour to dry your hair with these). The staff were beyond helpful and all who worked the recpetion desk spoke nearly perfect English. They were very kind when I tried to use by poor French skills and were never condescending - you will not find this at all hotels or shops in Paris, trust me. On Christmas Day I returned to my room (they do turndown service, which was highly unexpected) to find a card and bathrobe waiting for me as a gift. The staff printed maps off and helped me find the right train and Metro. The hotel is located in a quieter, upscale area of Paris and I felt completely safe walking around, even late at night in the dark and walking from the Metro stop even after midnight.
