The front desk is staffed 24 hours by very friendly staff. Getting to the more touristy, more bustly areas is a 20 minute walk or 6 minute Metro ride. I walked to the Louvre, Notre Dame Cathedral and Eiffel Tower with no difficulty from here - takes about 20 minutes. If you don't want to walk, there are 3 Metro stops withing 2 minutes of the hotel. The RER train direct to and from CDG airport stops 10 minutes from this hotel. The television does get 2 English channels, BBC and CNN only, but helpful when trying to stay in touch. You will find that many other 3-star Parisian hotels do have television, but only French channels, which can be a challenge when you need to know what's happening elsewhere. A small internet room is provided WITH a printer, which allows guests to print boarding passes and check flights. No extra charge for this service, unlike other hotels I tried that charged 5 Euro for 10 minutes on the internet. Paris is a wonderful city with fantastic sites, but can be a challenge for the first-time, single female, English-speaking traveller, as many Parisians are not fond of tourists. This hotel made it easy and pleasant and provided me with good memories. It was a pleasure to retreat from the bustle (and by Canadian standards), rude behaviour of many (but not all, of course) Parisians, to an oasis in the heart of the city. I could go on and on...don't hesitate, just book your room. Try for one of the mid-priced ones and enjoy your terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: LoriandMarkNC
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I recently stayed at the Hotel Sainte Beauve and couldn't be more pleased. It was very clean, beautifully decorated and had a very convenient location. The location is ideal, as the hotel itself is on a very quiet street in a safe neighborhood, and centrally located to many of the attractions in Paris. There are literally three different metro stops within a 1-2 block walk, and tons of cafes just a two block walk away! The room was small if you're comparing it to a huge suite in a small town, but compared to other accommodations in big cities, I feel it was rather spacious. The room was very tastefully decorated (and so was the lobby, with a crackling fireplace and comfortable sofas), and there were some elegant "extras" such as a towel warmer, robes and slippers to wear, etc. The bathroom was fantastic! I couldn't believe the size of it! (again, for a hotel in a large city), and it seemed to be brand new! The water pressure was better than I've had even at home, it was spotlessly clean and elegantly designed. Wireless internet was free and worked great. Staff were great too. Very helpful at the front desk... they even gave us maps and marked our way for us! We were able to purchase our Museum Passes at the desk, which was very convenient too. The breakfast was delicious, if you are interested in eating a "full breakfast" and paying for it (which we were). We didn't order the continental breakfast... we ordered a la carte from the menu and had omelettes. Room service was great too... at all hours of the day and evening. This is a small, boutique-type hotel which has more of a feel of a french country bed and breakfast. If you are looking for a uniformed bellman who runs to the door at 3am, this is not the place for you. But if you enjoy being greeted by friendly staff who actually know who you are, in a warm environment, this place is great! Like coming home at the end of a long day (of sightseeing!) We booked our room directly by calling the hotel because we wanted to be sure to get a room with a balcony. There was no problem communicating (in English), and we received exactly the room we requested. The price was extremely reasonable too! (compared to many other hotels we investigated when we were deciding). The only thing we would have liked, would be an alarm clock in the room. The only clock was a tiny digital readout on the corner of the television set. We found it a little unnerving to have to "depend" on a wake up call on the day we were leaving for an early flight. However, we did receive our wake up call on time and I have noticed that many other hotels in Europe don't have alarm clocks in their rooms either. At risk of going on and on forever, I will make myself stop now! Hope you find this info helpful!

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites”
Reviews.Author: boatbabe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, the staff friendly and helpful, and I only wish I traveled to Paris more frequently so I could stay there more often. The immediate neighborhood has a small selection of cafes and restaurants which we enjoy, and it's easy to get anywhere else on the metro. The only trouble we encountered, which is not at all the fault of the hotel, is that the rue St. Beuve is tiny and does not appear on all maps of the city; next time, we'll be sure to carry a more detailed map so we can more easily get back from the metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Quit Stressing - Just Book the Sainte Beuve”
Reviews.Author: housue
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to France - went crazy trying to decide where to stay. Spent way too much time and energy - got frustrated and thought, "I'm done - the pictures look good and it's a few bucks cheaper but on the map, it looks like it is way out in the boonies ...we'll see" What we saw was a smart, crisp, and classy hotel with small, clean rooms and common areas with super nice people at the front desk. I am so glad we stayed at the Sainte Beuve. The number one thing we liked about the hotel, though, was the location. Thankfully, not being in a heavily populated "tourist" section, there were still plenty of shops, resturants, and boulerangees surrounding the hotel. Even though on the map the Sainte Beuve looks like it is far away from the Seine, Notre Dame and the Louvre we were able to walk to those sights with no problem - lots to see along the way, too. The Eiffel tower and Champs Elysees was too far away for me to walk but there are several Paris metro stations around the hotel that will get you around Paris efficiently. Our best memory of Paris comes from Luxembourg Gardens which is a block and a half away. We took the time to relax and soak up the local flavor by eating chocolate crepes and watching neighborhood men play an intense game of bocce ball. So restful after a full day of sight-seeing. Bottom line - The pictures and good reviews of the hotel are accurate. We personally liked not being overrun with tourists but yet didn't feel like we were in the boonies - i.e. Plenty of things to see and do around the hotel. So, unless you like to be right in the middle of big crowds, do youself a favor and quit stressing on where to stay in Paris. Just book the Sainte Beuve.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: KateMSydney
Reviews.Content: Thanks to other reviewers for directing us to the Hotel Sainte Beuve, it was a really delightful experience. We stayed two days on our first stay, one on our second. The lounge and bar areas are really charming, whether for a drink or for breakfast. Our first room was a superior room, small as expected but quaint and attractive, with a great bathroom. On our second visit, we were upgraded to the suite, which was fantastic! If you can afford it, pay the extra for this. The hotel has very easy access to two metro stops, and ask the staff for recommendations for dinner - the restaurants were excellent. The most impressive aspect was the amazingly helpful staff - thanks Cecile for going the extra mile to make our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: BengalBrasserie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with my sister, brother and mum to celebrate our mother's birthday. The location couldn't have been better! The rooms were spotlessly clean, bathrooms sparkling and albeit the hotel was quite small, everything was catered for. The front desk staff, expecially Cecilia and Nicolas were so helpful, nothing was too much trouble and their English was excellent. The metro stops were close by as where plentiful restaurants and cafes. We couldn't have chosen any better. Port Royal RER station is approx 15 minutes walk, our connection to CDG Airport. Drinks in the hotel were expensive though, but Paris is expensive, one must arrive prepared to spend more than in other European cities. All in all a superb experience, I would have no hesitation in returning to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Golfah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 nights in June at the Hotel Sainte Beuve. We booked a double superior room and were not disappointed with any aspect of the room. The staff at the hotel were very nice and helpful. They made bookings for us and gave us some helpful tips. The position is great, far enough away from the main touristy areas but close enough to walk to many. The Luxembourg Gardens are a couple of minutes walk away and well worth taking advantage of. We would unwind by sitting down with a book for an hour or so after a busy day sight seeing before cleaning up and going out for dinner. The Metro,shops and restaurants are all within easy reach. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and when we visit Paris again we will say at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unclear pricing”
Reviews.Author: LondonsOurSpot
Reviews.Content: I confirmed a double room in this hotel by phone and was given a room number and a price per night per room. Our room was sited next to the lift and a very noisy boiler room so presumed that was factored into the price. When I came to pay, however, it transpired there were two people with the same name as me staying. That individual was paying the lower price and I was therefore obliged to pay the full rack rate, double that which was anticipated. Sharp practise or bordering on the fraudulent? You decide

Reviews.Title: “well managed hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: thomoto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Saint Beuve in late July. This was our third time at this hotel. The location is ideal, the staff are polite and knowledgeable, and the rooms are clean. We will stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect small Parisien hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjmorin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fantastic choice for those willing to stay in an area outside the tourist centers. That being said, it is close to two Metro stops and quite walkable to many tourist attractions. We were upgraded to a room with a terrace which was lovely, and although small, was similar in size to the majority of rooms in Paris. It was impeccably clean, quirky in its decorating and simply charming. The staff was warm, patient with my French, but fluent in English and very willing to help. Breakfast was delightful and served downstairs until noon - it was wonderful to have such flexibility. One of the best parts is the placement of the hotel in a neighborhood with many small restaurants where it appeared we were the one of few Americans. Overall, not luxurious, but simply wonderful and an amazing value given the weak dollar.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: Beck11217
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel, and a great value. The room was attactive, clean and comfortable. Most of the front desk staff was great. The lobby breakfast was nice -- it included yogurt and fruit rather than being a typical all starch French petit dejeuner -- but be prepared for sticker show; I think 15 Euros is rather a lot for tea, bread, fruit and a container of yogurt. I liked the location because Rue Sainte Beuve is very quiet, but only one of four cab drivers had any idea where is was. The proximity to the Jardin de Luxemburg meant that I walked through the gardens many times on my way to places on the right bank, which was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaMartini
Reviews.Content: The Sainte-Beuve is the perfect Paris hotel. It is small, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms are very nice. The location gives a choice of two metro lines and a large variety of good restaurants and places to have a drink. The street is very quiet. We would definitely stay there on another visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: tessVA
Reviews.Content: This was a great value and location for a recent four night stay in Paris. We were able to leave our bags when we arrived prior to check-in and they were in our room upon our return. The staff was able to provide some great nearby restaurant recommendations, but they were less capable when it came to assistance with tickets for exhibits, etc. We had a small problem with a blown fuse during our stay, but once we alerted staff it was taken care of in a timely manner. Would highly recommend this hotel - great location, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money - Beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Donnatela21
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked a weekend trip to Paris after getting a great 2 for 1 deal with Eurostar. After a lengthy review on trip advisor we finally decided to go with Hotel Sainte Beuve. Booking directly with the hotel I managed to get a standard room for a very reasonable 145EUR a night - So my expectations were not high but we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is located on a quiet side street in a less touristy area. With 3 metro stations within walking distance its great for getting around Paris. Although the rooms were fairly small they were extremely clean and beautifully decorated. The whole place had a cozy homely feel and I loved all the antique furniture. The bathrooms were also well kept and the separate toilet made it feel alot more spacious. Unfortunately the main reception was being refurbished at the time of our visit so we did not get a chance to eat downstairs but the breakfast we ordered from room service was delicious and well worth the money. I cant wait to return to Paris and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family, but I personally think I might try a more centrally located hotel so I can experience the full hustle and bustle of this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian Gem”
Reviews.Author: balcia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this spotless hotel for a week in November and it helped make our trip to Paris even more special. The staff could not have been nicer, going out of their way to help us with the computer, with directions to the metro and various sites, with restaurant recommendations, and with making sure we had transportation to get to the airport on the day we left Paris, which happened to coincide with the start of the railroad and metro strike. We were at the hotel with our friends( two other couples), and one morning we went to an outdoor food market and picked up bread and fruit and cheeses and olives for breakfast. The staff provided us with a lovely table and cutlery and happily served us coffee while we ate the food we had bought. The room we occupied was one of the remodeled ones and it was larger than I'd expected and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and the terry bathrobes provided were another example of the thoughtfulness to the comfort of guests. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: JamieSarahElisabeth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the Sainte Beuve room for two nights in November 2007. The hotel is small but well kept. The room is the best the hotel has and is nicely furnished but not spectacular. This is a small boutique hotel in a good location in Paris and there are many nice shops and restaurants within walking distance. Paris hotels are expensive, and this one is no exception considering what you get in terms of room size, but I did not leave feeling I had been ripped off. Also the staff were very helpful in booking restaurants for us and making recommendations, all of which were good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: AustinPlatt
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel in a good location. A good breakfast, clean room, friendly staff. Room was a little small but otherwise excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: Oldmans
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend of the 26th October and chose the Saint Beuve partly on the reviews here. We stayed in a classic room (2) which was excellent. The room was not very big but then none are in Paris in my experience. It was spotlessly clean and my girlfriend was very impressed with the black and white bathroom which was of the highest quality. The only minor down side of the room was that it got a little hot. Service was excellent on the whole although the front desk was not great on the first day when our request for a restaurant recommendation was met with a wave in the general direction of a wrack containing cards of local restaurants. On Saturday the guy at the desk was excellent, finding out info on attractions we wanted to visit and recommending and booking a restaurant for that evening. Breakfast was also good particularly the croissants which were very fresh. As for the restaurants....on Friday we ate at a place in Rue Stanislas (cant remember the name) which we picked from the wrack mentioned above. Food was good but way overpriced for what we got. A meal for two , with wine came to 174 euros and that was without one starter! On Saturday we dined at Le Timbre just 3 doors down from the hotel. This did a three course meal for 30 euros. Portions weren't large but very much in keeping with the French style. Wine was good as was the food. Tables are all butted up together as the place is tiny so if you want romantic then this isn't for you. However, the atmosphere was very good and we spent some time chatting to the Brazilian couple who sat next to us. All in all , a much better experience than Friday. The Hotel Saint Beuve was small but very good and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we want to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MyPorch
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Sainte Beuve two different times (Nov 06 and Nov 04) and we don't even want to think about trying another hotel in Paris. I am sure there are others we would like, but we find the Sainte Beuve so perfect for us that we don't want to risk it. The rooms are clean and cozy. The breakfast is yummy. The staff is helpful and friendly. The only reason I would give it a bad review would be to keep too many people from finding out about this wonderful spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find..”
Reviews.Author: MWhitney
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Paris and the Hotel Sainte Beuve is great. The rooms are clean and the staff is very helpful- Cecilia is wonderfully kind and knowledgeable about the area. We traveled with 2 young children (6 and 11 months) and they made us feel so comfortable and welcome. It is a decent walk to most places - but that is Paris! Around the corner on Notre De Champs is a wonderful bakery with the best breakfast croissants and cappuccino in Paris, don't miss it!! Bring your umbrellas and jackets â€“ even in summer â€“ the weather is extremely unpredictable. All in all a great hotel!! Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Sainte-Beuve”
Reviews.Author: drechsel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Sainte-Beuve and had a great time. We had the connecting rooms. My wife and I in one and my sons in the other. The staff was friendly and helpful always. Whatever we required was a request away. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the price was just right ($340 Euros a night for 2 connecting rooms). The hotel is one a quiet street yet very close to the intersection of Blvd Raspail and Blvd Montparnasse. The cafes are hopping here and the street was still lively at midnight on a Thursday night. We preferred Le Select but there are plenty of choices. Cab fare to the center of Paris (Louvre, Notre Dame, Etc) is approx 15 Euros 1 way. It is about a mile walk from the hotel. There is a train station nearby, Gare Montparnasse, that can be utilized for day trips to Chartres (see the Cathedral) and Versailles (Go when the fountains are running). When we return to Paris, we will stay again at Sainte-Beuve.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sainte Beuve”
Reviews.Author: TileKiln
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic stay at the Sainte Beuve. The hotel is spotlessly clean and service is friendly and professional. The breakfasts are excellent, and served in the comfortable lounge. We were helped with restaurant reservations, Le Timbre is three doors from the hotel, so tiny we nearly missed it. The food is excellent pure and simple, relying on fresh ingredients. Also we ate at Parc de Cerf only five minutes from the hoel , this was also excellent. Both were recommended by the hotel. There are also many other fine restaurants Le Dome nd Le Cupole, sadly time ran out for us but we will definitely return to this superb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: jock_strap
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for for a week at the end of March 2007 for our honeymoon. The warm welcome, friendly staff, simple but good breakfasts (which went on until 12!), clean and comfortable bedrooms all made for a very relaxed and enjoyable time away in a beautiful part of the city. The hotel is close to good frequent public transport enabling acces to the whole city and there are a number of good small places to eat within a five min walk.

Reviews.Title: “a cute quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Binkette
Reviews.Content: This is a really cute hotel. Its small and intimate. The rooms are absolutely tiny, but I believe this is par for the course in Paris. The decor in the foyer is gorgeous, the rooms are fine but not of the same standard as you would expect from the foyer. The location is great, within walking distance of the latin quarter the luxemburg gardens. This hotel is great for a short weekend break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the 6th”
Reviews.Author: nyc2theworld
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel on a sleepy street just off a major Blvd. Close to the Jardin de Luxembourg, which is great, and near the Metros. My mom and I agreed that it was cute, but the room was smaller than I expected and the bathroom was nice but odd (bidet weirdly protruding from the bathtub, bathtub too narrow). Don't get me wrong, this place is really, really great, but likely better for couples than anyone else. Very helpful staff and clean, plush decor. Would definitely stay here again (with a lover :).

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chubaer
Reviews.Content: good moderate price Hotel near Metros, Park, restaurants. Staff is exceptionally helpful. Room clear and fresh. Expect bath rather then shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice. Can't go wrong with this one.....”
Reviews.Author: MikeandCarmelyn
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days in Paris following 2 weeks in Greece. This hotel is a must for the "moderate priced" hotels. We paid e176 a night. The staff was extremely helpful and the location is excellent. If I had to knit pick, I would say there is no room service and the showers don't have curtains. The decor is very nice and there aren't too many rooms. I will definitely return. If you go, Le Dome is a short walk away and an excellent choice for dinner if you like seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Upon the hill travel tours”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Smith_NYC
Reviews.Content: This exquisite hotel (very nice decoration) offers a central location, very close to a magnificent garden (Jardin du Luxembourg). Safe area, walkable distance to nice neighborhood restaurants. Enjoyed food markets close by (organic market on Raspail boulevard). Warm welcome from the staff . My partner just loved it. For sure an address to remember.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we found this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jason_from_London
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the strength of the positive feedback. This is a real 'find' in Paris. The Hotel Sainte Beuve is a well-located, comfortable and welcoming hotel. The hotel is tastefully decorated with a warm, homely feel. Our room was light, beautifully furnished with antique pieces, with an incredibly comfortable bed and nice touches such as plentiful storage, robes and slippers. On a map the hotel may seem to be away from the heart of St-Germain but in fact this is all within walking distance. This is the best way to discover St-Germain; wonderful streets with antique shops, bookshops, cafes, bakeries mixing with familiar designer names. There are two metro stations near to the hotel, Vavin and Notre Dame des Champs. There are plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants just around the corner from Rue Sainte Beuve. We chose not to take breakfast at the hotel. A previous reviewer suggested the nearby Columbus coffee shop for takeout coffee and muffins, perfect for a morning walk through the Jardin de Luxembourg. We also enjoyed galettes and crepes at Le Vieux Journal, and bistro fare at the Cafe Vavin...a lively street-corner cafÃ© with friendly staff. If you do decide to stay at this hotel, you must eat at 'Le Timbre', just a few doors down. If you like french cuisine but served in a simple, fuss-free manner, you'll enjoy yourself here. It's small (hence the name 'The Stamp') but that's the charm of it. We liked it so much we dined twice during our stay. English is widely spoken here because the clientele is mostly American/English (travel guides often recommend the restaurant)...oh, and the owner/chef is English too! The cuisine is distinctly French...and it was clear that evening that the locals love him too as there was plenty of handshaking and kissing. Another recommendation is a tour of Paris in the iconic CitroÃ«n 2CV!! The French nickname these cars '4 roues sur 1 parapluie' (four wheels on a umbrella). This proved to be a real head turner as our driver weaved his way around central Paris! You can take package tours or create your own depending on what you want to see or visit. The drivers can pick you up from your hotel too. We've been to Paris many times and we would be happy to stay at the Sainte Beuve again and again.

Reviews.Title: “sissinewtravelers”
Reviews.Author: sissi2007
Reviews.Content: I am just back from Paris Where I have a great time and the Sainte Beuve Hotel has certainly contributed to it. Thanks to the efficient and smily staff it made my stay very pleasent and I would definitely recommemd such a place.

Reviews.Title: “St Valentine at the Sainte Bueve”
Reviews.Author: mimitravels
Reviews.Content: After looking at several locations, we selected Sainte Bueve for the location (6th arrondisement), and were delighted by the property. The rooms are clean, cozy and well furnished. And the hotel staff was professional and extremely helpful. They helped make restaurant reservations; you must try Le Dome which is in walking distance. But the staff went the extra mile, as they helped me with St Valentine's surprise for my partner by having the flowers, champagne and my personal message ready in the room. The room service was prompt and cheerful. This is a hotel that I would recommend to any leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Sainte Beuve”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieWashington
Reviews.Content: The Sainte Beuve is a charming hotel. The hotel staff was very pleasant and very helpful. The rooms are typical of Paris, i.e. small, but well maintained and with very nice bathrooms. The public areas are welcoming with a workiing fireplace in the main room. The hotel is on a small side street but well located with access to bus and subway transportation a short block away. The area has neighborhood amenities such as small restaurants, patisseries, etc. It is also a short walk to Blvd. Montparnasse and all of its cafes and entertainment venues. All in all a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “My Home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ulysseys
Reviews.Content: I stay at the St. Beuve every time I visit Paris, and have stayed there about a half dozen times. I have stayed at more expensive hotels in Paris, but for me the St. Beuve surpasses them all. The location is great. Its a quick 10 minute walk to St. Germain through the Luxenbourg gardens, which is also a great place to go jogging. As well there are some great restaurants within a 5 minute walk (you have to go to Le Dome). The hotel itself is quintessentialy Parisian. the rooms are clean, well decorated and comfortable, although not luxurious, they are very clean, and comfortable, with a view over the quiet street of St. Beuve. My favourite thing about the hotel is the lobby which feels like someone's living room. Staff is also very friendly, and always willing to fix you a drink or suggest restaurants or museums. I like going to the St. Beuve because of the location, the friendly staff and the clean and comfortable rooms. But more than anything the St. Beuve doesn't feel like I'm staying at a hotel. It feels like I'm visiting a friend's house in Paris - thats why I go back so often

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TopperTell
Reviews.Content: My wife and our three children stayed at this wonderful hotel this past August upon the recommendation of friends from the Netherlands. As many Europeans, our friends travel a lot, and they told us this small charming hotel is their favorite in all of Europe. Now we know why. First, the rates at the hotel were extremely reasonable. We had two adjoining rooms which worked perfectly for us. Second, the location is sensational, just two blocks from Jardin de Luxembourg where I ran early each morning with many other travelers and locals. The hotel is only a block from two separate metro stops. Third, the rooms were just fabulous. They were impeccably clean, appointed with antiques, and stocked with first class soaps and other products. And the breakfast which is served in the hotel lobby each morning could not be beat. Finally, the staff at the first-rate hotel could not have been nicer. Although I was reluctant to write this review for fear the hotel would become overrun with other travelers, currently unaware of what they would be missing, I would be remiss to not share the accolades this small, charming hotel, and its staff, so richly deserve. Merci Hotel Le Sainte-Beuve!

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable room in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: lattemom1
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was lovely. Very quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Quaint little palace!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An AMAZING little hotel. Rooms are amazing and some afford beautiful views of the Rue de Saine Beuve. Location!!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sainte Beuve
HotelInfo.Address: 9, rue Sainte-Beuve, 75006 Paris, France
